gurmukhi: ਸੁਭੈ ਸੁਵਰਨ ਕੇ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਬਾਂਧੇ ਗਜਾ ਮੈ ॥
transliteration: Soubhai Suvaran Ke Pattra Baandhe Gadaa Mai||
translation: The sheets of gold covering the maces looked splendid.

gurmukhi: ਭੲੀ ਅਗਨਿ ਸੋਭਾ ਲਖੀ ਕੈ ਧੁਜਾ ਮੈ ॥
translation: Their glory exhibited the blaze of fire at their tops.
The warriors moved in the field and rotated their discs.

gurmukhi: ਅਪੋ ਅਾਪ ਮੈ ਨੇਕ ਅਾੲਿ ਸਰਾਹੈ ॥੪॥੨੨੨॥
transliteration: Apo Aap Mai Nek Ghaae Saraahai||4||222||
translation: They appreciated those on their sides who inflicted deep wounds.4.222.

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾਂ ਭੀਮ ਭਾਰੀ ਭੁਜਾ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਾਹੈ ॥
translation: There the great warrior Bhim used his weapons with his arms.

gurmukhi: ਭਲੀ ਭਾਂਤਿ ਕੈ ਕੈ ਭਲੈ ਸੈਨ ਗਾਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Bhali Bhaant(i) Kai Kai Bhalai Sain Gadhai||
translation: He was trampling the armies nicely.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤੇ ਕੳੁਰ ਪਾਲੰ ਧਰੈ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਧਰਮੰ ॥
transliteration: Oute Kaur Paalan Ddarai Chhatra Dharamannd||
translation: On the other side Yudhishtar was bound by Kshatriya discipline,
And was performing wonderful and holy Karmas.5.223.
All of them looked elegant with ornaments like armlets.
Their necklaces of gems glistened and their turbans looked graceful on the heads of both the warriors of the same age.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਮੀਰ ਧੀਰੰ ਦੋੳੂ ਪਰਮ ਓਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Dooo Meer Dhderan Dooo Param Ojan||
translation: Both the Chiefs were men of great strength and composure.
Both were either king Mandhata or king Bhoj.6.224.

gurmukhi: ਦੋੳੂ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਨਾ ਬਧੈ ਅੱਧ ਅੱਧੰ ॥
transliteration: Dooo Beer Baanaa Badhai Addh Addhan||
translation: Both the warriors had tightened their tearing shafts.
Both the weapon-wielding warriors began to wage war in great fury.
